actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, Treasury Department, Energy Department.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 and title 31, United States Code, to increase the tax on diesel fuel and gasoline for highway use in order to reduce the Federal deficit, and the public debt through the Public Debt Repayment Trust Fund.
short_title: Reduction of the Deficit and Public Debt Revenue Act of 1985

summary.text: Reduction of the Deficit and Public Debt Revenue Act of 1985 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to impose an excise tax on gasoline and diesel fuel in addition to the present nine cents per gallon tax on such fuels. Sets the rate of such tax at: (1) ten cents per gallon after October 1, 1985; (2) 20 cents per gallon after October 1, 1986; and (3) 30 cents per gallon after October 1, 1987. Imposes a floor stock excise tax of ten cents per gallon on gasoline. Establishes within the Treasury the Public Debt Repayment Trust Fund. Transfers to such trust fund 50 percent of the revenues raised by such additional tax. Prohibits any revenues raised from such addition from being transferred to the Highway Trust Fund or the Airport and Airway Trust Fund.

titles.title: Reduction of the Deficit and Public Debt Revenue Act of 1985

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 and title 31, United States Code, to increase the tax on diesel fuel and gasoline for highway use in order to reduce the Federal deficit, and the public debt through the Public Debt Repayment Trust Fund.
